widgets_values: A cinematic scene of a street interview in busy New York City. A young woman in her early 20s with long blonde hair styled in a high ponytail and striking blue eyes stands on the sidewalk wearing a black top and a delicate black lace choker around her neck. An interviewer's hand extends a microphone labeled "LTX-2" toward her from the right side of frame. The interviewer asks in a clear, professional voice: "How do you feel with the fact that this video was made locally on ComfyUI using LTX-2?" The woman listens intently, her expression shifting as a subtle smile spreads across her lips and her eyes brighten with interest. She then responds in a calm, natural tone: "It's time to buy an RTX6000 Pro." She remains relaxed, giving a slight nod as she finishes speaking. Steam rises from a street vent behind her, drifting through the cold winter air. Yellow taxi cabs marked "TAXI" on their sides pass by in the background beneath a green street sign reading "VRAM ST". A single pedestrian walks in the distant background. The soft rumble of city traffic, a distant taxi horn, and the gentle murmur of the city fill the ambient soundscape throughout.

The camera maintains a steady eye-level tracking shot, keeping the man centered as he continues his walk. The residential scenery immediately begins to transition; the picket fences and houses give way to the textured brick facades of a commercial district. The natural lighting deepens slightly, shifting from bright amber to a softer dusk purple, though the warm rim light on the man remains consistent. He walks with a fluid, unbreaking gait, passing by darkened shop windows and streetlamps that have just flickered to life. The focus remains sharp on him while the storefrontsa hardware store, a barber shopblur past in the periphery, establishing the shift from a quiet neighborhood to a main street environment without any interruption to the camera's movement.

A cinematic scene of a street interview in busy New York City. A young woman in her early 20s with long blonde hair styled in a high ponytail and striking blue eyes stands on the sidewalk wearing a black top and a delicate black lace choker around her neck. An interviewer's hand extends a microphone labeled "LTX-2" toward her from the right side of frame. The interviewer asks in a clear, professional voice: "How do you feel with the fact that this video was made locally on ComfyUI using LTX-2?" The woman listens intently, her expression shifting to confusion and her eyes wander. She then responds in a calm yet confused, natural tone: "Like I said, buy an RTX6000 Pro." She remains relaxed, giving a slightly annoyed nod with a smirk as she finishes speaking. Steam rises from a street vent behind her, drifting through the cold winter air. Yellow taxi cabs marked "TAXI" on their sides pass by in the background beneath a green street sign reading "VRAM ST". A single pedestrian walks in the distant background. The soft rumble of city traffic, a distant taxi horn, and the gentle murmur of the city fill the ambient soundscape throughout.

A cinematic scene of a street interview in busy New York City. A young woman in her early 20s with long blonde hair styled in a high ponytail and striking blue eyes stands on the sidewalk wearing a black top and a delicate black lace choker around her neck. An interviewer's hand extends a microphone labeled "LTX-2" toward her from the right side of frame. The interviewer asks in a clear, professional voice: "How do you feel with the fact that this video was made locally on ComfyUI using LTX-2?" The woman listens intently, her expression shifting to disgust and anger and her eyes narrow to a glare. She then responds in an angry tone: "How about I fucking stab you?" She remains relaxed, giving a slightly annoyed nod with a smirk as she finishes speaking. Steam rises from a street vent behind her, drifting through the cold winter air. Yellow taxi cabs marked "TAXI" on their sides pass by in the background beneath a green street sign reading "VRAM ST". A single pedestrian walks in the distant background. The soft rumble of city traffic, a distant taxi horn, and the gentle murmur of the city fill the ambient soundscape throughout.

inputs.text: A medium close-up shot features a Caucasian man with a closely shaven head and face, wearing a black baseball cap with "PNTR" in white letters on the front, and a dark grey t-shirt with "JUST DO IT" visible across his chest. A small black microphone is clipped to his shirt collar. He is positioned slightly to the left of the frame, looking intently downwards and to his right, his eyes focused off-camera. His facial expression is one of deep concentration, with his brow slightly furrowed. As he looks down, a quick sniff sound is heard, and then he speaks with a deep male voice and a slightly frustrated tone, saying, "I think it's so bad." The camera remains static throughout, maintaining a shallow depth of field, which keeps the man in sharp focus while the background is softly blurred, revealing a light-colored wall with white wooden shelving or trim, and a partially open white wooden door on the right. After a brief pause, another short, audible sniff is heard. The man then continues to speak, his voice maintaining the same quality, as he states, "So bad. So bad." He elaborates further, emphasizing his point with a final statement, "This got to be, it's got to be the worst tool I've ever seen."
